intro: Torularia humilis var. hebecarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited torularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically pale green to yellowish in color, and the plant produces small, round fruits. It thrives in open, sunny habitats and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
